My sister took this for 3 years, starting at age 66, after he rBorderline Personality Disorder  BPD rages got out of control and this turned her into an emotionless robot. Her personality completely disappeared and she’s just ‘flat’ all the time. The rages are gone, but so is she! She’s contented to spend her entire day in her bedroom and has no need of companionship. I was given Risperidone for my Borderline Personality Disorder and Schizophrenia. I can't remember my exact dosage but it was increased overtime and it worsened my mental state. I'd heard before that it would help my mental instability and mood swings along with helping me regulate myself mentally overall. It did not help me and the strongest side effect I got from it was the increased appetite. I went from 60kg to 78kg in 3 months. I was constantly eating even when I wasn't hungry and I couldn't stop, even when I wanted to. I was eating until I was sick and even though I didn't want to at all and was painfully full, my brain would just tell me to get more and more because of the increased appetite. It is impossible to fight your appetite.I had to be taken off it because it was making me worse but I was still left with an increased appetite and habit of overeating even after I was long gone off it. I do not recommend it, ever.

I was prescribed risperidone in 2018, after being on Quetiapine for  Borderline Personality Disorder (BDP) diagnosis (was misdiagnosed instead of ocd and adhd). I am completely aware that different drugs affect everyone different, so if it works for you great! However this is probably one of the medications I would give everyone who takes it a strong warning about! The effects of risperidone hospitalised me 5 times as it was only on the last visit we worked out it was the tablets. It caused this muscle dystonia which came on suddenly and caused all of my muscles to seize up uncontrollably, caused my head to bend completely backwards, my tongue to stick out, arms and legs cramping up. The best way to describe how it looked was as if I was having an exorcism. It was agonisingly, painful and embarrassing as I couldn’t get help for hours as my body had contorted so badly I couldn’t move to call help. It took a high dose of lorazepam and other medications to calm it a bit until it was out of my system.

When I first started I gained a lot of weight. However after changing my diet it calmed down and I started loosing again. It works really well for most all my side effects, dissociation, delusions, aggression and depression. Just be very careful of what foods you eat and try to stick to a healthy diet. I was suddenly able to go throughout the day without the urge to hurt myself for almost the first time in my life. Truly great.

My 5 year old son was given this medication for anger associated with ADHD. He started on 0.5 mg and it worked right away. He was better able to control his anger and frustration. I started noticing what I thought were tics which we attributed to a stimulant (and so discontinued that) but kept him on the Risperidone. In fact, the psychiatrist increased his dosage to 1 mg. While the medicine worked in terms of his anger/frustration, he developed a very scary side effect: tardive dyskinesia. I stopped the medicine rather abruptly because of the abnormal movements and we went through a grueling two weeks or so of withdrawal. I know this medicine has some positive effects, but please use with caution.
